comments:
Sometimes (not reliably reproduceable) I get the following exception whenever I
hit Esc in a modal dialog. Once this behaviour has started, only a restart of
Eclipse will cure it. I use Emacs bindings.

The shell has just been created in this case, and I don't believe this 
exception can happen unless something else bad has happened in SWT.  Are there 
any stack traces before this one?
Moving to Platform SWT for comment....

No, no other traces in the log. The log was clean for the time from startup
until the first of these exceptions were logged. Then a new one had been added
each time I would hit Esc in a modal dialog.
FH was fixing things in this area.  FH to investigate.

Doug, can you (or anyone in the UI team) reproduce this problem ?
I fixed some code in this area a few months ago.
No, I can't reproduce this problem.  But then again, I'm not running Windows XP.

Doug, in SWT we are using P1 to mark very important problems report that need 
to be fixed for 3.1.
Closing a dialog using the esc key is a very common task, multiple it by the 
number of people using Windows and still all we got is one guy that can (or 
could) (not reliably) reproduceable the problem. 

Sorry, I don't agree this problem should be marked as P1.
Sorry the last change was accidental.
